TrustedTypePolicyFactory.summary: The TrustedTypePolicyFactory interface of the {{domxref("Trusted Types API", "", "", "nocode")}} creates policies and allows the verification of Trusted Type objects against created policies.

TrustedTypePolicyFactoryCreatePolicy.summary: The createPolicy() method of the interface creates a object that implements the rules passed as policyOptions.

TrustedTypePolicyFactoryIsScript.summary: The isScript() method of the interface returns true if it is passed a valid object.

blockquote.para: The purpose of the functions isScript(), , and is to check if the object is a valid TrustedType object, created by a configured policy.

TrustedTypePolicyFactoryIsScript.returns: A {{jsxref("boolean")}} that is true if the object is a valid object.

TrustedTypePolicyFactoryGetAttributeType.summary: The getAttributeType() method of the interface allows web developers to check if a Trusted Type is required for an element, and if so which Trusted Type is used.
TrustedTypePolicyFactoryGetAttributeType.returns: A string with one of:Or, null.

TrustedTypePolicyFactoryIsHTML.summary: The isHTML() method of the interface returns true if it is passed a valid object.

blockquote.para: The purpose of the functions isHTML(), , and is to check if the object is a valid TrustedType object, created by a configured policy.

TrustedTypePolicyFactoryIsHTML.returns: A {{jsxref("boolean")}} that is true if the object is a valid object.

TrustedTypePolicyFactoryGetPropertyType.summary: The getPropertyType() method of the interface allows web developers to check if a Trusted Type is required for an element's property.
TrustedTypePolicyFactoryGetPropertyType.returns: A string with one of:Or, null.

TrustedTypePolicyFactoryIsScriptURL.summary: The isScriptURL() method of the interface returns true if it is passed a valid object.

blockquote.para: The purpose of the functions isScriptURL(), , and is to check if the object is a valid TrustedType object, created by a configured policy.

TrustedTypePolicyFactoryIsScriptURL.returns: A {{jsxref("boolean")}} that is true if the object is a valid object.

TrustedTypePolicyFactoryEmptyScript.summary: The emptyScript read-only property of the interface returns a object containing an empty string.

remarks.para: This object can be used when the application requires an empty string to be inserted into an injection sink which is expecting a TrustedScript object.

TrustedTypePolicyFactoryEmptyHTML.summary: The emptyHTML read-only property of the interface returns a object containing an empty string.

remarks.para: This object can be used when the application requires an empty string to be inserted into an injection sink.

TrustedTypePolicyFactoryDefaultPolicy.summary: The defaultPolicy read-only property of the interface returns the default or null if this is empty.

remarks.para: See The default policy for more details.
